name: TheAtlantic
text: Mindy Kaling's "Never Have I Ever"—along with "Selah and the Spades" and "The Half of It"—tells a story about a young woman of color who has the freedom to fumble her way through her teen years, @ethiopienne writes. https://t.co/awGSee7Rc6

name: TheAtlantic
text: "To defend Trump’s business holdings, however, the Justice Department has been forced to reinterpret its own opinions in the narrowest way possible," Jane Chong writes: https://t.co/RTHsV2nMrm

name: TheAtlantic
text: "We push away from what we know." How the work ethic of artists syncs with this moment of pandemic: https://t.co/LaBFmGib6L

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The insect is relentless in its search for hosts. Those who fight it must be relentless too." Sarah Zhang on the quietly audacious project that changed the lives of cattle, deer, and humans throughout North and Central America: https://t.co/76OFCG6cCs

name: TheAtlantic
text: "When a lone creep who refuses to wear a mask or stay home, being the 10th person to join a chant against the offender takes no courage; being the 10,000th to retweet a denunciation takes even less courage," @gcaw writes: https://t.co/I17ebZq3VZ
